Description: Ostracon, large fragment of the body of a brown pottery vessel, the fabric is partially black in section, the interior is covered with a brown resinous deposit, the exterior is slightly grooved and covered with a light-brown slip and remains of five lines of Coptic text written in black ink, now faded and worn in parts, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.192)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36463) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36463)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 323 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: SB XVIII 13509 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
